programme.title: A Piece of the Action
programme.desc: Two con men (Sidney Poitier, Bill Cosby) are persuaded by a retired policeman (James Earl Jones) to volunteer their services to a ghetto youth center.

programme.title: Greased Lightning
programme.desc: World War II veteran Wendell Scott (Richard Pryor) runs Georgia moonshine and becomes the first black NASCAR driver.

programme.title: Moving
programme.desc: A yuppie (Richard Pryor) loses his job in New Jersey and moves his wife (Beverly Todd) and family to Boise, Idaho.

programme.title: Goodbye Bruce Lee: His Last Game of Death
programme.desc: Footage filmed before Lee's death in 1973 is blended with new material in this tale of a kung-fu master vs. drug lords.

programme.title: The Dragon Lives Again
programme.desc: Bruce Lee (Siu-Lung Leung) opens a gym in hell.

programme.title: Enter Three Dragons
programme.desc: Three fighters attack smuggling at its source in the port of Hong Kong.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Felipe Luciano hosts this showcase of Latin music on Soul!; musicians Tito Puente and Willie Colon are accompanied by their musical groups.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Female singing trio LaBelle; conga drum/bongo musician Mongo Santamaria.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Exuma; Taj Mahal; actress Cicely Tyson, star of the motion picture, "Sounder."

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Guests include Tony Award-winning singer Linda Hopkins and the musical group Earth, Wind & Fire.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: The Spinners; The Jimmy Castor Bunch.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: "Coming To Soul Flix" features "Arena," "The Big Doll House," "Caged Heat," "Assault on Precinct 13," "The Bad Bunch" and others.

programme.title: Q: The Winged Serpent
programme.desc: A fleeing gangland flunky (Michael Moriarty) finds the New York nest of Aztec deity Quetzalcoatl, the man-eating flying serpent.

programme.title: Piranha
programme.desc: Two people (Bradford Dillman, Heather Menzies) unwittingly free a mad military scientist's (Kevin McCarthy) mutant fish near a summer camp and resort lake.

programme.title: The Protector
programme.desc: Two NYPD cops are sent to Hong Kong to catch a drug lord who has kidnapped the daughter of his former associate.

programme.title: Cleopatra Jones
programme.desc: Federal agent Jones (Tamara Dobson) tries to rescue her framed boyfriend (Bernie Casey) from a drug-queen pervert known as Mommy (Shelley Winters).

programme.title: An Eye for an Eye
programme.desc: A San Francisco policeman (Chuck Norris) quits the force to avenge his partner's murder by Asian drug dealers.
